Package ch.mazluc.game

Class ConsoleInteractionUtils

java.lang.Object
ch.mazluc.game.ConsoleInteractionUtils
public class ConsoleInteractionUtils extends Object

Utility class for console interaction. Reads and checks different kinds of user input using the `java.util.Scanner` class.

Usage: 

 
 ConsoleInteractionUtils utils = new ConsoleInteractionUtils();
 int value = utils.readInt(); // read an integer without checking a range
 String value = utils.readNonBlankOrEmptyString(); // read a non-blank or empty string value
 int valueInRange = utils.readIntInRange(1, 10); // read an integer in the range
Version:
1.0
Author:
Luca Mazza

  • Constructor Details

    • ConsoleInteractionUtils

      public ConsoleInteractionUtils()
      Creates a new instance of the `ConsoleInteractionUtils` class.

  • Method Details

    • readInt

      public int readInt(String msg)
      Reads an integer from the user. Prints an error message if the input is not an integer. Prints a prompt message before reading the input.
      Parameters:
      msg - the prompt message
      Returns:
      the integer

    • readIntInRange

      public int readIntInRange(int min, int max)
      Reads an integer from the user, verifying that it is in the range. Prints an error message if the input is not an integer. Prints a prompt message before reading the input.
      Parameters:
      min - minimum value
      max - maximum value
      Returns:
      the integer

    • readNonBlankOrEmptyString

      public String readNonBlankOrEmptyString(String msg)
      Reads a non-blank or empty string from the user. Prints an error message if the input is empty or contains only white spaces. Prints a prompt message before reading the input.
      Parameters:
      msg - the prompt message
      Returns:
      the string

    • readStringWithMinMaxLength

      public String readStringWithMinMaxLength(String msg, int minLength, int maxLength)
      Reads a string from user input with a minimum and maximum length.
      Parameters:
      msg - the message to display before prompting for input
      minLength - the minimum length of the string
      maxLength - the maximum length of the string
      Returns:
      the string entered by the user

    • isValidGridSize

      public boolean isValidGridSize(int height, int width)
      Check if the grid size is valid.
      Parameters:
      height - height of the grid
      width - width of the grid
      Returns:
      true if the grid size is valid, false otherwise

    • readValidGridSize

      public int[] readValidGridSize()
      Reads a valid grid size from the user. The grid size is valid if the height and width are greater than 1, the height * width is less than the maximum number of cells, and the height * width is even.
      Returns:
      the grid size

    • isCoordinateInBounds

      public boolean isCoordinateInBounds(Coordinate coord, Grid grid)
      Check if the coordinate is in the bounds of the grid.
      Parameters:
      coord - the coordinate
      grid - the grid
      Returns:
      true if the coordinate is in the bounds of the grid, false otherwise

    • readValidCoordinate

      public Coordinate readValidCoordinate(int gridHeight, int gridWidth)
      Reads a valid coordinate from the user. A valid coordinate is a coordinate that is in the bounds of the grid.
      Parameters:
      gridHeight - the height of the grid
      gridWidth - the width of the grid
      Returns:
      the coordinate

    • readEnterToContinue

      public void readEnterToContinue()
      Reads an integer from the user.

      public void clearScanner()
      Clears the scanner.

    • closeScanner

      public void closeScanner()
      Closes the scanner.
